headline: Flayed Man Cheese Ball
description: This cheese ball is perfect for Halloween, or just for serving guests at the Dreadfort.

video.description: Creep ’em out completely this Halloween with a cheese ball that’s frighteningly good.
video.name: Flayed Man Cheese Ball

name: Flayed Man Cheese Ball
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup roasted red peppers, drained and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly coat plastic face mask with cooking spray (see Cook's Notes). Line the face mask with plastic wrap, taking care to press it down fully into the nose and eyes.

Reserve two or three slices of prosciutto and set aside. Tear the remaining slices of prosciutto into strips and lay them into the mask to form the "muscle tissue." Start around the eyes, leaving eyes blank, and then create the cheeks, chin, and forehead.
Take the two whole green olives and position them in the eye holes, pimento side-down. Set the mask aside.

Combine the softened cream cheese, Cheddar, and Havarti cheeses in a mixing bowl. Add the chopped green olives and roasted red peppers. Use an electric mixer or clean hands to mix until thoroughly combined.

Take a heaping spoonful of the cheese mixture and arrange it to form an eye around one olive, and then the other. Gently lay handfuls of the cheese mixture all around the mask, taking care not to move the slices of prosciutto. Press the cheese down as you work to fill in all of the crevices. When the mask is full, gently press in the cheese mixture all around the mask. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

Invert the mask onto a serving platter and gently remove the mask and the plastic wrap. You should be left with a gorgeous (and freaky) face. If there is cheese showing around the bottom edges, use the reserved prosciutto slices to cover it before serving.

review.reviewBody: first time making something like this! it was fun and fairly easy. i did make changes to reduce serving size (small party) and added some garlic, onion powder and paprika, i also used a small mask and everyone loved the taste but no one wanted to cut into it! will try this again!
What an awesome idea!!! My coworkers loved it for our Halloween bash!
Took my time with this and had fun making it. Big hit at potluck.

I made this for a party we had last weekend. (Oct 15th) This was a big hit. Everything about it was perfect. I did change the eyes to Wilton's royal icing eyes. I think it's important to spray the mask with pam before adding the Saran Wrap like the recipe states. It helps hold the plastic wrap in place for the details etc before packing with the cheese mixture. It was so quick and easy to make. Turned out perfect.
Hard finding the mask. Prosciutto was hard to find, too. Tasted great, big hit at the Halloween party!

Absolutely Faboulous! 
A great recipe for many occasions 

It was great --- even though I overlooked including the lips and mouth. I guess this was the "in-law" version . . . what a way to keep them quiet

Great recipe. I heated up some red pepper jelly and glazed 2 pearl onion for the eyes. Then brushed the jelly over the prosciutto and poured the rest around the service platter. Super creepy. I had a prop tongue I stuck in the mouth.

So I had an absolutely fabulous time making this!
Unfortunately my coworkers were afraid to try it
I was not at the potluck so they couldn’t ask questions.
I still thought it looked awesome and thanks so much for sharing

Terrible good! Very gross looking and easily draws attention to it. I roasted my own red bell pepper, omitted the chopped green olives, mixed in some minced garlic, and a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce all in my blender. Someone has already requested it for another event.
Excellent recipe! The only change I made was pepper-jack instead of havarti. Always a huge hit!

This dish was so easy to make and came out incredibly creepy. When I brought it to our neighborhood Halloween party, the hostess moved her centerpiece and placed my dish in the center. I made it just as described, it took me 10 minutes flat to make it and it was the first dish that was gone at the party, Amazing recipe and one I'm going to make each year from now on! Thanks so much for the recipe. Wish I had taken a picture.
Loved this, hard to find already shredded havarti cheese however. I won the contest at work for most creepiest dish!
Pretty straight forward and easy. Did not bother with the spray before the plastic wrap.
Won the Spookiest Snack prize with this Flayed Man appetizer! I used my favorite cheese ball recipe for the filling but followed the instructions to build the face. Worked perfectly!
This recipe was easy to make and it looked just like the photo. But the taste wasn't great. The prosciutto was hard to cut and bite through. Also, prosciutto dried out fast.
This was awesome! I won the "Most Innovative Food" in our Halloween food contest!
This was awesome! I won the "Most Innovative Food" in our Halloween food contest!
It was definitely a hit at the Halloween party....No one wanted to eat it because it looked so awesome

I made this for my mah Jongg group for Halloween and they loved it! It came out perfect. I did change the ingredients for the cheese ball b/c it sounded very bland. I used minced Kalamata olives, lots of minced scallions, minced fresh red pepper, roasted garlic, lots of freshly ground black pepper and a few dashes of Tabasco. It was delicious!

This cheese was so real looking it was awesome!!
I would add more red pepper for flavoring.
Thank you so much for the creative recipe!! Big hit at an office party!
Will make again. Turned out fantastic!!

I made this for a Halloween party and it was a huge hit. I used Boars Head prosciutto, which was pricey, but delicious. Nobody wanted to be the first to cut into it, so I did, and then guests just kept digging in for more. It does look like real muscle tissue! It was so delicious too. I did not use salt or pepper, which is optional. I used a hand mixer for the cheese, never my hands!
Very easy!!!

Turned out amazing!! I used "best ever cheeseball" recipe. After doing some research I put the cheeseball mixture into the plastic wrap lined mask and let 'set' in the refrigerator for 1 hour. After putting the 'face' onto my platter, I added the olive eyes and prosciutto. I found this to be much easier than lining the mask with prosciutto. It also allowed me to make adjustments to the face before covering. Will definitely make again!!!
If I were Gordon Ramsey, I would say that this is disgustingly delicious!
I made this for our VFW Halloween party. I won 1st prize. I used a scarier mask plus I used black olives for the eyes and almond slivers for the teeth. I also mixed in some dice jalapenos.
huge hit at halloween!!
This was a huge hit at my Halloween Party. It was easy to make. I skipped the olives and used cream cheese, cheddar jack and mozzarella. I think that's a way better combo.
Came out great. Super tasty and very easy to make. Great recipe.

This came out so cool. The hardest part about it was finding the mask. All of the stores had the plain white mask that stopped at the forehead but I found the correct one at AC Moore. The most important thing to remember about making the flesh is that you have to use proscuitto, not ham as I saw on another site. The proscuitto should be sliced super thin like authentic italian deli's do. Also, in addition to putting the initial blobs of cheese over the eyeballs, push the cheese mixture into the nose before filling the head the rest of the way. I made two of these and the first one had a flat nose that I had to play around with to get it to look right. The second one came out fantastic. They were a big hit at the parties. Lots of people taking pics on their phones. Unfortunately, nobody wanted to be the first to cut into it and ruin it so it sat for quite a while, untouched. You might have to be the first one to cut into it after all of the pictures are taken.

Not only did it taste great, it was a big hit! I'm a nurse and brought it to the hospital for our Halloween potluck. I reduced the amount, used a taco shredded cheese mixture, diced chilies and diced red peppers, and coppa for the muscle tissue. Such a fun and great tasting party appetizer!

This came out so cool. The hardest part about it was finding the mask. All of the stores had the plain white mask that stopped at the forehead but I found the correct one at AC Moore. The most important thing to remember about making the flesh is that you have to use proscuitto, not ham as I saw on another site. The proscuitto should be sliced super thin like authentic italian deli's do. Also, in addition to putting the initial blobs of cheese over the eyeballs, push the cheese mixture into the nose before filling the head the rest of the way. I made two of these and the first one had a flat nose that I had to play around with to get it to look right. The second one came out fantastic. They were a big hit at the parties. Lots of people taking pics on their phones. Unfortunately, nobody wanted to be the first to cut into it and ruin it so it sat for quite a while, untouched. You might have to be the first one to cut into it after all of the pictures are taken.

I am giving this a five star for presentation as it looked so awesomely gruesome on the table with blood red beet chips around it. I made it with plastic eyeballs instead of olives and followed a picture of the structure of the muscles of the face for authenticity. Looked amazing!! The host of the party who is a doctor was super impressed.
Followed recipe pretty much exact, our mask had a mouth opening so we added roasted red peppers for the lips and bacon pieces for teeth. Was terribly disgusting looking but tasted great

Definitely 5 stars for creativity! Was super easy to make, I concentrated really hard on making sure that the nose and mouth were stuffed! Replaced eyes with black olives and made my own cheese ball (sorry, not a fan of olives). This was an absolute hit on Halloween party, maybe even too much- people wouldn’t eat the cheese ball just to preserve the face! Thank you, what a great idea!
I made it as it was written. It was a big deal at the party. It is a very eye-catching centerpiece. Tastes good too.
What a neat idea. 5 stars for creativity and for flavor. This should be a hit at the pot luck.
This ended up with the best presentation ever. Though I did use our family recipe for the actual cheese ball filling. (Bacon, this recipe needs bacon - ha ha ha)

Amazing!! I brought this to a Halloween party and EVERYONE was taking pics of it and asking who made it. No one wanted to cut into it to "ruin" it! This was a huge hit! I put toothpicks into the olives while I packed the cheese in, so I could keep the olives straight. But...don't worry, you can straighten them out once it's flipped onto the plate. I also shaped the lips with a toothpick once it was flipped out of the mask because they didn't come out too well. I combined the cheese ball part of the recipe with another dip mix. I put the cream cheese, green olives and cheddar into my food processor. I then added a packet of Cugino's "Garlic Schmarlic" dip mix. So delicious! People are still talking about it, and were posting pics all over social media!
Delicious and super easy. I put the prosciutto and olive eyes on at the end. I used cream cheese, havarti, cheddar, roasted red peppers, olives and bacon bits in the cheese ball.

I think my mask was a little smaller than the original. Only used 2 packages of cream cheese, and half of the other cheeses. Really needed the mixer to combine the ingredients. Also added a teaspoon of pickled peppercorns for a little zing.
Everybody was impressed with the gross presentation, and it
tasted wonderful!

This is an amazing appetizer. EVERYONE at the party was amazed by it! Like others had mentioned, no one would eat it, so eventually, I took the first bite and then people did eat it. I did use my own cheeseball recipe, but this is an awesome presentation. This was our 11th annual Halloween party, and I will now make this every year from now on.
This turned out really creepy. The cheese is delicious.
Everyone loved it!
I made mine in a brain mold last year and it was huge success making it againn this year!!
Absolutely brutal.

This was AMAZING! I made it for a halloween party and it was a HUGE hit. Everyone wanted to know how I did it, and the following year I was asked to make it again. Get a basic mask - think "jason" and you are on your way. So so easy!
This was a big hit and oh so gross and yummy for our Halloween party this year!! Thanks for posting it!!
Our guests were amazed - and I think the kids were afraid to eat it!
brought this to a party and it was a total hit!!!
very good. quite the hit.
Followed the recipe exactly and it was a huge hit. Not only was the visual presentation great, this was very tasty. Highly recommend

The cheese ball itself was pretty good but the presentation was phenomenal! Super easy to make too. I'll definitely make it again! Instead of pimento I used black peppercorns for the pupils. This was really fun to make and it garnered a lot of attention! Thanks for sharing your recipe and creative side Tara!

Was a huge hit at the party!! Everyone took pictures of it and was thoroughly impressed (tasted great too)! Similar to other recommendations, I added the eyes after I had flipped it onto the plate. That made it easier to place them. I set it out to get room temp for about 40 minutes before everyone ate into it. It was a perfect consistency by that point (otherwise this style dip is rather firm/thick right out of the fridge). Thank you for sharing this very creative idea for a recipe!

Fun halloween dish. Super easy to make and customize. Literally any mask you find can be used and any cheese ball recipe you like will work. I made some changes with my cheese ball because I absolutely hate the taste of olives. I used the three cheeses listed but added a packet of green onion soup mix, minced garlic and a little worcestshire sauce and it tasted pretty good. It was a hit at the party. I posted it and my sister just asked "Why?"

I am giving 5 stars for the creative idea of using the face mask. The cheeseball itself was a little bland. It makes a lot, so I wouldn’t recommend this for a small party. I also only used one 3-oz package of prosciutto, and I had one slice left (and I bought the bigger mask of the two sizes the store had). I’m guessing it made about 3 cups of cheeseball mixture. It definitely was a conversation starter at the party!
This was so easy to make and was the hit of my party. I didn't use the cheese ball recipe, instead filled it with a spinach dip made with cream cheese.

Great idea for Halloween! The prosciutto I bought wasn't any good so I ended up using capocollo instead. It looks the same but tastes much better than prosciutto. Can't wait to see everyone's faces when they see this appetizer at the party!
This was a huge hit at the company Halloween BOOffet! Everyone loved it and it was yummy too! Thanks for sharing such a fun and simple recipe!
Everyone liked it ..!
This was fantastic and a big hit at the party. This gross looking face will be at next years Halloween party. (I did use my own cheese ball recipe)
I made this as per the recipe, and it came out great! I made sure to make this the day before to let the flavors meld. Everyone at the party loved it. Awesome recipe

This was a total hit at the Halloween party we attended. The host was taking pictures and it was for sure a conversation piece throughout the night. I personally didn't think it had a lot of flavor so next time I might make a different cheese dip. There was quite a bit left over but will be used at bunko this week so it won't go to waste.

Total shock value! This is so creepy looking people can't wait to stick a knife in his eye. I used my own dip recipe (sorry) and made sure it was super chilled before removing from mold. I put his olive eyes in after removing from mold. Best Halloween idea ever!

I made this for a Halloween party and just like everyone has said, it was a huge hit. Lots of pics. I followed the recipe except I added some roasted pistachios and almond flavored with cumin and chili powder. I also served with plain triscuits and baked crostinis with olive oil and curry. Delish. 5 stars.
I am lactose intolerant so I used goat cheese. and my friends loved it!

This turned out awesome and so fun! I thought it was likely going to fail on me but I would give it a whirl and I'm glad I did. I used my own dip which wasn't a whole lot different from the recipe, just really stole the design concept. The only problem with it was that quite a few people were afraid to mess it up by slicing into it and a couple other weak bellied souls were just scared of it. I loved it!

We made this for our walking dead dinner night. Everyone loved it. The only difference I did was used olives with garlic stuffed in them and used Virginia ham sliced real think for the skin. (it was cheaper) other than that great dish.
This is delicious and was a smash hit at the Halloween party. I'm making this for The Super Bowl but I'm making it into a football shape this time!!

Use cocktail onions for eyes. Seriously, it's gross. Or peeled grapes. I actually made this in 2010 (obviously not from this recipe) using a cheese recipe that included reduced red wine... It was yummy and gnarley.
I made this for a Halloween party and it was fairly easy to do (it did take the hour and a half to make) and a BIG hit!
I made this for a Halloween party and it was fairly easy to do (it did take the hour and a half to make) and a BIG hit!
Excellent. Our guests loved it and it was both delicious and easy.

Made this just for fun on Halloween and offered it to trick or treaters that came through... "human face or candy, your choice". Was cute addition to our Halloween tradition! Only changes: I put the prosciutto on at the end, after molding the cheese in the mask so I had more control over final appearance. Also chopped up roasted red pepper to use as brains.

This was the gruesome hit of our Allrecipes pre-Halloween party. One of my co-workers scooped out an eyeball right away and ate it. Sick. The cheese mixture was exactly the right amount for the mask, and it firmed up nicely and held its shape. And it tasted really good! Tips: 1) It's tricky to position the olives so they don't get all wonky when you add the cheese filling. Next time, I might add them afterwards. 2) I used the edge of a spoon to emphasize the outline of the lips. I think that made it extra life-like. 3) The next time I make this, I might download a photo of the musculature of the face, and try to copy that with the prosciutto. Because that's how I roll. 4) This isn't just for Halloween; how about a Game of Thrones or Walking Dead viewing party?

We loved this for our adult Halloween costume party. Everyone laughed, took pictures and of course asked for the recipe. I live in a very small rural community and prosciutto is not available in my grocery store. I had to think of something else to use so I chose Buddig Beef. I cut it into strips and layered it on. It looked great!

Excellent idea! The results are truly gruesome. However, I would recommend 1 small change. I used it very very thin sliced corned beef which is more pliable and looks more like blue slash. Plus it's cheaper. I also used a different cheese ball recipe thats was a little more exciting.
Great Halloween Party dish. My guest were scared to eat it because it was so awesome looking. It tasted even better. Look forward to using it again.

This was the BEST halloween treat anyone could ever make! Its soooo creepy looking, its hard to believe it is food! I made this for my teenage son and his friends for a Halloween party and it was a huge hit! Plus it tasted great.

This is a great Halloween party appetizer. It's not complicated but it is more difficult and time consuming than you'd think from watching the video. I used my food processor and my stand mixer to save time and my wrists,so it was pretty quick. I must note that some people were really intimidated by this dish, some didn't want to look at it and others were afraid to cut into it (they went for the eyes first). The presentation just gets more gruesome from there. Those who were brave enough to eat it loved it and took pictures of it.
I added bacon bits for some dirty teeth. Love this idea.
Very good! I used Dill Havarti and added Jalapeno, Garlic and Cayenne Pepper, but did not used Red Peppers. It looked really good and tasted good! Was quite the hit for a Halloween potluck.
Amazing! My guests loved it! Much easier to make than I thought it would be.
This was super easy and people loved it at work for our Halloween "boooffet." I used the cheese ball recipes as written except I used pimento-filled olives and not pitted.

This so creative. Everyone tonight asked me about it. I used the southern cheese ball recipe from this site. It looked so gross I could'nt get my 15 year old son to taste it. If I could give this 10 stars I would!! Great idea!!!
This was the hit of the party when I made it last year. Every morsel was devoured before I even had any! I'll be making this again this year.

I made this for a shuffle board tournament and it was a huge success! Watched people look, whisper and point until someone got brave enough to take a bite! Will definitely be making this again this year!
Amazing, and fun entertainment yup, ita a keeper

This was super easy and a HUGE hit. I took it to a Halloween party and everyone was commenting and taking pictures of it. I did use a different cheese ball recipe though. Only because I did not have all the ingredients on hand. So I used 3 cream of cheese, 3 tbl (1 oz)dry ranch dressing mix, 3 cups sharp cheddar, 1/4 c real bacon bits and black olives for eyes. Extremely tasty and easy! 
PS: I did watch the video. Also my face had already been cut into, so his chin is missing ;0
Looked great for our Halloween partyand everyone loved it and it tasted great!
Yummy and creepy!
I made this for a halloween party and it was a huge hit. So quick and easy to make and tasted delicious. I will definitely use this recipe again.
Great idea!!! I used the Easy Cheeseball II recipe though.

Made this for an appy before dinner tonight and everyone LOVED it! I used our favorite cheese ball recipe: 'Herman Reunion Cheese Ball' fron this site. I used black olives for the eyes too, b/c that's what I had on hand. This was super simple and turned out really cool looking (I wish the lighting was better b/c my pic does not do this justice). Awesome concept, and something that I would've never thought of...This is definitely gonna be a new Halloween staple in my house~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
Made this for a Halloween party and it was a HUGE hit! Really disgusting looking! Used the recipe from Easy Cheese Ball II for the cheese mixture and it was delicious.
I made this and took it to work and everybody loved it. Thanks!
